sentences.sContent: She bowed and left the stage.
sentences.sCn: 她鞠了一躬，离开了舞台。

sentences.sContent: Corbett entered the room, bowing respectfully.
sentences.sCn: 科比特走进房间，恭敬地鞠了一躬。

sentences.sContent: The servant bowed low and handed his master the sealed note.
sentences.sCn: 仆人深深一鞠躬，把那个封好的短笺递给了主人。

sentences.sContent: This is done with a formal bow to the king or queen.
sentences.sCn: 与此同时，还要向国王或女王正式鞠躬行礼。

trans.tranOther: to bend the top part of your body forward in order to show respect for someone important, or as a way of thanking an  audience
the act of bending the top part of your body forward to show respect for someone when you meet them, or as a way of thanking an audience
